item.title: Minecraft ‘Failed to Verify Username’ Error FIX
item.dc:creator: minevote.xyz@gmail.com
item.category: how to migrate your minecraft account
item.description: Overview You may have tried to join your Minecraft server and been rejected due to the error “Failed to verify username” or “Invalid Session”. This issue is normally because the client’s launcher failed to authenticate with Mojang’s session servers. Luckily, you can fix this error with just a few steps. You may also be running a non-premium ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
Overview

You may have tried to join your Minecraft server and been rejected due to the error “Failed to verify username” or “Invalid Session”. This issue is normally because the client’s launcher failed to authenticate with Mojang’s session servers. Luckily, you can fix this error with just a few steps.

You may also be running a non-premium version of Minecraft. If you did not pay for Minecraft, you will not be allowed to join most servers due to the server running in online mode, however, it can be changed to offline mode fairly easily.

How to resolve

How to resolve on a premium server

  1. Close your game.
  2. Log off your account from your launcher.
  3. You will then be asked to type in your email and password again, please do.
  4. Once logged in, you can then start your game and join the server.

How to allow cracked players on your server

  1. Head to the Game Panel and stop the server.
  2. To the left of the panel click “Config Files” and then click “Server Settings”.
  3. Locate “Online Mode” and set it to disabled, then click save.
  4. Head back to the Game Panel dashboard and turn the server back on. It should now let you join.

Common Issues

After restarting the launcher, players still can’t join
If you are using premium Minecraft and have already followed the steps on to resolve the error and still cannot join, try restarting the server.

item.title: How To Install Minecraft Data Packs
item.dc:creator: minevote.xyz@gmail.com
item.description: Overview There are many great ways to further customize your Minecraft gameplay. One of the easiest ways to customize your server is with the use of datapacks. You can use datapacks to add new advancements, functions, loot tables, structures, and more. This is a great alternative to adding mods/plugins onto your server as it does ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
Overview

There are many great ways to further customize your Minecraft gameplay. One of the easiest ways to customize your server is with the use of datapacks. You can use datapacks to add new advancements, functions, loot tables, structures, and more. This is a great alternative to adding mods/plugins onto your server as it does not require installation client-side or for you to change your server version from Vanilla Minecraft. Keep in mind that they are only made for Java Edition and not Bedrock Edition. Datapacks can be added to your Minecraft server easily and we will walk you through each step of the process.

How to add datapacks

Finding a pack

  1. The pack needs to come from an trusted site such as Vanilla Tweaks or Gamemode 4.
  2. Confirm that the datapack you want to download is made for the version of Minecraft that your server is running.
  3. Download the pack to a known directory on your computer. It generally downloads as a .zip, do not extract this.

Uploading the datapack to the server

  1. Stop your server
  2. Access your server files through an FTP client such as FileZilla.
  3. Open the world folder and then enter the datapacks directory.
  4. Make sure that you are opening the world folder that your server is set to load. You can check the name of world your server is loading in the world field on the main page of the game panel.
  5. Drag the datapack you downloaded previously into the datapacks folder.
  6. Once the file is fully uploaded, head back to the game panel and start the server.

Commands
The datapack command was added after 1.13, so these are not relevant for any versions under 1.13.

  • /datapack disable: Disables a datapack of choosing
  • /datapack enable: Enables a datapack of choosing
  • /datapack list: List all of the enabled/disabled datapacks

Common Issues

Datapack doesn’t show in the server
The datapack not showing is generally from the file not being uploaded to the correct directory. Enter your world folder, than datapacks folder to ensure that the datapack is properly uploaded. Also, make sure that you did not unzip the pack. If you check both of these and still are experiencing issues, make sure that the datapack is made for the same version of Minecraft that your server is running.
